entry.title: Bernlef (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to tradition Saint Ludger healed the Frisian bard Bernlef of his blindness (pictured) and taught him to play psalms on his harp?

entry.title: a trio of galaxies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as of 1.06 billion years ago, three supermassive black holes from a trio of galaxies in the constellation of Cancer were colliding?

entry.title: Nicholas Carlini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nicholas Carlini showed that ChatGPT could leak personal information?

entry.title: Takara's Treasure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Takara's Treasure was created because its artist wanted to draw a story about a boy who speaks a local dialect?

entry.title: Kuomintang Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in addition to having been a centre for local involvement in Chinese politics, the Kuomintang Building in Vancouver has hosted social events including a wedding reception?

entry.title: Ron Tiavaasue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ron Tiavaasue was born in Samoa, grew up in New Zealand, played college football in the United States, and now plays professional football in Canada?

entry.title: Axis Rule in Occupied Europe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the concept of genocide was introduced in the 1944 book Axis Rule in Occupied Europe?

entry.title: Michael Kettle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michael Kettle received an award at the age of 80 for his work as a cricket groundskeeper?

entry.title: Terrace on the Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Madonna once operated an elevator at Terrace on the Park?
